file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 34-32-11-04 - NAV UNIT STRAP BOARD ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL NAV UNIT STRAP BOARD ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the NAV Unit Strap Board Assembly. B. The NAV Unit Strap Board Assembly is installed on the back side of the Integrated Navigation Unit mounting tray. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY NAV UNIT STRAP BOARD ASSEMBLY - ALL 34-32-11-000-801-A REMOVAL NAV UNIT STRAP BOARD ASSEMBLY - ALL 34-32-11-400-801-A INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 34-32-11 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-32-11-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. NAV UNIT STRAP BOARD ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the NAV Unit Strap Board Assembly. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-32-01-000-801-A/400 INTEGRATED NAVIGATION UNIT - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 213 113CZ Electronic compartment - LH upper side 214 113CZ Electronic compartment - RH upper side D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward electronic compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the VOR/ILS 1, VOR/ILS 2, ADF 1, ADF 2, DME 1 and DME 2 circuit breakers and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to them. (2) Make sure that the landing gear safety pin is installed to the NLG (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (3) Open access door 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-32-11 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the Integrated Navigation Unit from its mounting tray ( AMM TASK 34-32-01-000-801-A/400). (2) Release the four screws which attach the mounting tray to make easier the access to the NAV Unit Strap Board Assembly (2). CAUTION:THE NAV UNIT STRAP BOARD ASSEMBLY CAN BE DAMAGED BY ELECTROSTATIC DISCHARGE. GROUND YOURSELF BEFORE YOU TOUCH THE NAV UNIT STRAP BOARD ASSEMBLY. ALWAYS TOUCH IT BY THE EDGES. (3) Release the screws (4), the lock washers (5) and the washers (6) which attach the NAV Unit Strap Board Assembly (2) to the mounting tray. (4) Remove the acrylic cover (3). (5) Carefully pull out on the NAV Unit Strap Board Assembly (2) and disconnect the flat connector (1) from it. (6) Remove the NAV Unit Strap Board Assembly (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-32-11 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL NAV Unit Strap Board Assembly - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A ZONES 213 214 DET. A C 1. FLAT CONNECTOR 2. NAV UNIT STRAP BOARD ASSEMBLY 3. ACRYLIC COVER DET. B 6. WASHER (3) 5. LOCK WASHER (3) 4. SCREW (3) DET. C 145AMM340544.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-32-11 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-32-11-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. NAV UNIT STRAP BOARD ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the NAV Unit Strap Board Assembly. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-32-01-400-801-A/400 INTEGRATED NAVIGATION UNIT - INSTALLATION WM 34-90-00 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 213 113CZ Electronic compartment - LH upper side 214 113CZ Electronic compartment - RH upper side D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward electronic compartment I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A CAUTION: • THE NAV UNIT STRAP BOARD ASSEMBLY CAN BE DAMAGED BY ELECTROSTATIC DISCHARGE. GROUND YOURSELF BEFORE TOUCH THE NAV UNIT STRAP BOARD ASSEMBLY. ALWAYS TOUCH IT BY THE EDGES. • BE VERY CAREFUL WHEN YOU CUT CONFIGURATION STRAPS SO AS NOT TO DAMAGE THE NAV UNIT STRAP BOARD ASSEMBLY. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 34-32-11 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (1) Configure the NAV Unit Strap Board Assembly (2). Refer to the Wiring Manual (WM 34-90-00). (2) Carefully connect the flat connector (1) to the NAV Unit Strap Board Assembly (2). (3) Put the NAV Unit Strap Board Assembly (2) in the installation position. (4) Put the acrylic cover (3) in its position. (5) Install the screws (4), the lock washers (5) and the washers (6) which attach the NAV Unit Strap Board Assembly (2) to the mounting tray. (6) Install the four screws which attach the mounting tray. (7) Install the Integrated Navigation Unit in the mounting tray ( AMM TASK 34-32-01-400-801-A/400). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the VOR/ILS 1, VOR/ILS 2, ADF 1, ADF 2, DME 1 and DME 2 circuit breakers and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from them. (2) On the RMU 1, push the "PGE" key to get access to the "System 1 Page Menu". (3) Push the "Maintenance" key to get access to the "Maintenance Data System 1" page. (4) On the "Maintenance Data System 1" page, push the "Strap" key to get access to the "System 1 Strap" page. (5) Push the "NAV Unit" key to get access to the "NAV Unit 1 System" page. (6) Make sure that the straps are correctly cut. (7) On the "NAV Unit 1 System" page, push the "Return to Radios" key to return to the normal operation. (8) Repeat the steps 2 thru 7 for system 2, using the RMU 2. (9) Close access door 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (10) Remove the landing gear safety pin from the NLG (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/ 200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 34-32-11 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
